metadata.scenario_description: Structured activity time where children are working on puzzles at tables. Child_5 uses delayed echolalia functionally - repeating phrases from a favorite TV show to communicate needs and emotions. The teacher recognizes these patterns and responds to the underlying intent. When child_5 says 'to infinity and beyond' while reaching for a puzzle piece another child has, the teacher interprets this as a request and facilitates sharing. Later, child_5 echoes 'I'm not scared' (from a movie) when the lights flicker briefly, which the teacher acknowledges as self-reassurance. The session demonstrates how echolalia serves communicative functions.

layer1_events.transcription: נראה שרועי רוצה את החלק הזה

layer2_events.description: fidgeting while engaged with puzzle task
functional use of delayed echolalia to request puzzle piece
layer2_events.trigger_description: wanting puzzle piece held by peer

layer2_events.description: used delayed echolalia 'to infinity and beyond' while reaching toward puzzle piece
interpreted child_5's echolalia and facilitated sharing
shared puzzle piece after adult facilitation
positive vocalization after receiving puzzle piece

layer2_events.activity_description: continued puzzle work with adult support

layer2_events.description: used delayed echolalia for self-reassurance saying 'I'm not scared'
layer2_events.trigger_description: responding to light flicker with movie quote

layer2_events.description: acknowledged child's self-regulation and provided reassurance
asked child_5 for help with puzzle
responded to help request by pointing at puzzle piece
continued focused work on puzzle with fidgeting
